main event: A military source reported a sighting of a green ball of fire falling straight down at a high rate of speed in Albany, Georgia, on 7 January 1956.
interesting points: The observation was made by a military source, adding credibility to the report.
The object was described as a green ball of fire falling at a high rate of speed from 7000 to 3000 feet.
The report includes detailed information about the weather conditions and winds at the time and place of the sighting.
The conclusion was uncertain, with the initial hypothesis being a meteor, but the nature of the object remains unknown.
Despite the lack of a duration report, the sighting and description were documented in the report, adding to its significance.
sighted object: green ball of fire falling at high speed
